source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk1
evidence_span: annealed Zircaloy-2 (which normally exhibits low, saturating growth strains) exhibited accelerated growth to rates comparable with cold-worked Zircaloy-2 after irradiation to fluences > 4 × 10²⁵ n·m⁻² at normal reactor operating temperatures (about 553 K)

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk1
evidence_span: 25% cold-worked Zircaloys at the same temperature (that is, an increase in the already high rate of growth at least for fluences up to 6 × 10²⁵ n·m⁻²)
conditions: fluence up to 6 × 10²⁵ n·m⁻², temperature ~553 K

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk1
evidence_span: higher rates of accelerated growth at fluences > 4 × 10²⁵ n·m⁻² in iodide-grade single crystal zirconium compared with zone-refined single crystal zirconium (containing about 3000 and 2000 μg/g of impurities, respectively)

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk1
evidence_span: zone-refined single crystal zirconium (containing about 3000 and 2000 μg/g of impurities, respectively)

extra_properties.irradiation_growth_rate: lower accelerated growth compared to iodide-grade

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk2
evidence_span: The growth rates show the same temperature dependence in each case even though the rates for cold-worked Zircaloys are an order of magnitude higher than annealed Zircaloys
conditions: low temperatures (<553 K), low fluences (<2×10²⁵ n·m⁻²)

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_042_chunk2
evidence_span: The growth rates show the same temperature dependence in each case even though the rates for cold-worked Zircaloys are an order of magnitude higher than annealed Zircaloys
conditions: low temperatures (<553 K), low fluences (<2×10²⁵ n·m⁻²)

extra_properties.irradiation_growth_rate: order of magnitude higher than annealed Zircaloys
